title.narrative: EDUCATION SECTOR COORDINATION WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS

description.narrative: By 2020, key education stakeholders are equipped to plan and coordinate activities, including in emergencies, which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-age children, particularly girls and those in vulnerable regions, have access to quality basic education, including in emergency situations.

participating-org.narrative: DIRECTION ENSEIGNEMENT MATERNEL PRIMAIRE ET NORMAL

mailing-address.narrative: Winston Churchill Avenue P.O. Box 1181 Yaoundé

sector.narrative: Education sector planning including coordinating role, SDG 4, etc.
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

related-activity.ref: 0690/A0/05/885 ACCESS TO QUALITY BASIC EDUCATION FOR VULNERABLE CHILDREN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, key education stakeholders are equipped to plan and coordinate activities, including in emergencies

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the coordination of the Education sector through the Local Education Group (LEG), the Education in Emergencies Working Group, the North-West/South-West Education Cluster, and the Taskforce on Inclusive Education. This support allowed the inclusion of issues related to education in emergencies, resilience, child protection, education of children living with disabilities, improvement of the safe, healthy, and protective environment, mental health, psychosocial support, gender-based violence and improvement of the Education Management Information System in policy and strategies of the education sector. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:03/02/2022
